Dear Mr. Hogue:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.

initiated.
09/08/2021 Contact - Face to Face Interview with Staff via TEAMS
09/09/2021 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
09/13/2021 Pre-Exit Conference
ALLEGATION:
Facility is not reporting their restraints to DCWL.
INVESTIGATION:
Social Service Worker was interviewed via TEAMS on September 8, 2021.
Social Service Worker said she is made aware of restraints right after the occur by
the direct care worker that completed the restraint. Social Service Worker said she
then notifies the guardian and foster care workers within 12 hours. Social Service
Worker said she enters them into MiSACWIS within 72 hours and routes them to her
supervisor for approval. Social Service Worker did not indicate ever sending them to
DCWL mailbox.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face via TEAMS on September 7,
2021. Chief Administrator said the Social Service Worker handles the restraint
reports and he only approves them in MiSACWIS.
Document Review:
• A review of Physical Restraints in MiSACWIS was completed on September
9, 2021. South Bluff noted two physical restraints completed between
7/01/2021 and 9/07/2021.
• A review of the DCWL mailbox log was reviewed. There were no restraints
reported to the DCWL mailbox for South Bluff.
2

APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 722-02B GUIDANCE FOR RESTRAINTS IN CHILD CARING
INSTITUTIONS
Process for CCI's with MiSACWIS Access All CCI's with access
to MiSACWIS must enter all restraint incident reports on
MiSACWIS. All sections including the incident description
section and the review section must document the details
outlined in the Incident Reporting section of this item. Agencies
should follow these steps for reporting and review:
• Complete all fields in the MiSACWIS incident report detailed
in the Incident Reporting section in this item.
• Submit to supervisor for review.
• Create a PDF of the incident report.
• Generate and send the parent notification letter the same
day as the restraint.
• Email the PDF incident report and parent notification to the
Division of Child Welfare Licensing (DCWL).
• Maintain a copy of the email for tracking purposes.
ANALYSIS: The facility is not sending the incident reports to DCWL as
required by policy.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status.
